'''Unwin Hyman Ltd.''' was a British publishing company known for publishing the works of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

Unwin Hyman Ltd. was formed in 1986, as a result of the amalgamation of publishers [[Allen & Unwin]] and Bell & Hyman. Robin Hyman became chief executive of the company upon its formation, with Allen & Unwin continuing as its Australian-based subsidiary, until the firm was acquired by [[HarperCollins]] in 1990. 

HarperCollins has since sold Unwin Hyman's academic book list to Routledge. <ref>[https://collections.reading.ac.uk/special-collections/collections/george-allen-unwin-ltd-archive/ George Allen & Unwin Ltd. Archive], ''University of Reading''.</ref>
